articles.title: This is the number one priority for Artemis I - CNN Video
articles.description: NASA prepares to send mankind to the moon and Mars with the launch of the Artemis I space capsule. CNN space correspondent Kristin Fisher has more details on the US space agency's latest mission.

articles.author: Paul LeBlanc and Ethan Cohen, CNN
articles.title: Beto O'Rourke off the campaign trail in Texas with bacterial infection
articles.description: Texas Democrat Beto O'Rourke announced Sunday that he has been diagnosed with a "bacterial infection" and after receiving care at the hospital, he will be "resting at home," postponing events in his campaign against GOP Gov. Greg Abbott.

articles.author: Ashley Strickland, CNN
articles.title: Artemis I's trip around the moon will pave a path to Mars
articles.description: Before landing the first humans on Mars, NASA wants to return to the lunar surface and establish a sustained human presence on the moon. The lessons learned from the beginning of the Artemis program could impact when and how humans explore Mars.

articles.author: Ashley Strickland
articles.title: What the words you'll hear during the moon mission launch really mean
articles.description: Don't let the jargon used by NASA mission teams throw you off if you're tuning in to the Artemis I launch Monday. Here are some of the words and phrases you can expect to hear before, during and after liftoff.

articles.title: How to watch the Artemis I mission lift off to the moon
articles.description: Here's everything you need to know about the uncrewed Artemis I mission: What it is, where it's going, why, how to tune in, tracking mission milestones, a timeline and countdown to launch, and more.

articles.author: Nouran Salahieh, Paradise Afshar
articles.title: 'Get out now': Mayor urges residents to flee ahead of rising river waters in Mississippi
articles.description: The mayor of Mississippi's biggest city urged residents to "get out now" on Saturday as record-setting rain threatens to flood streets and creep into homes within the next two days.
articles.content:

articles.author: Analysis by Clare Sebastian, CNN
articles.title: Analysis: 'Slower burn.' Russia dodges economic collapse but the decline has started
articles.description: Six months after invading Ukraine, Russia is bogged down in a war of attrition it didn't anticipate but it is having success on another front — its oil-dependent economy is in a deep recession but proving far more resilient than expected.

articles.author: Opinion by Marco Rubio
articles.title: Sen. Rubio: Why the Artemis I launch is so important
articles.description: Sen. Marco Rubio writes that Monday's scheduled launch of Artemis I to the moon is a cause for patriotism and pride. He says America's journeys through the stars are a great chapter in the story of our nation.
articles.content:

articles.author: CNN
articles.title: Artemis I in numbers
articles.description: Almost 50 years later, NASA is ready to return humans to the lunar surface -- and it begins with the Artemis I mission. Here are the big numbers that make the mission a monumental feat.
articles.content: 1 hr 53 secafter liftoff, the rocket is 2,400 miles (3,860 km) above Earth. The remaining upper stage of the Space Launch System detaches and Orion completes the trip to the moon without the rocket.… [+2 chars]
